complexity.technical: 3: Documentation architecture requiring content analysis, categorization, and cross-referencing system
complexity.business: 4: High impact - enables role-based onboarding and improves developer productivity across all specializations
complexity.coordination: 2: Single comprehensive task with planning phase followed by execution

summary: 625-line monolithic guide difficult to navigate by role â†’ 6 focused skill-based guides (150-250 lines each) with hub-and-spoke cross-reference system
root_cause: Single comprehensive guide served all audiences equally, requiring developers to read through irrelevant sections to find role-specific information

solution.approach: Content analysis and categorization into skill-based guides with reference-based duplication strategy and bidirectional cross-linking
key_changes: docs/semantix-guide/README.md: Navigation hub with role-based and task-based quick access
docs/semantix-guide/skills/general.md: Universal practices - communication, workflow, testing for all developers
docs/semantix-guide/skills/architecture.md: System design patterns, multi-state architecture, orchestrator pattern theory
docs/semantix-guide/skills/frontend.md: CSS architecture, 4-tier pattern, visual polish, streaming UI
docs/semantix-guide/skills/backend.md: State implementation, streaming architecture, message flow, backend gotchas
docs/semantix-guide/skills/debugging.md: Systematic investigation, demo-first development, all 10 common gotchas
docs/semantix-guide/skills/refactoring.md: When to refactor, ultra-modular pattern, right-sizing, real examples
docs/semantix-guide/skills/*: Hub-and-spoke cross-reference system linking related concepts across guides

validation: All 6 skill guides created with complete content, cross-references verified, navigation hub functional, master guide preserved

gotchas.issue: Overlapping content (e.g., 'Talk Before Code' applies to multiple skills)
gotchas.solution: Reference + Brief Context pattern - primary home in general.md, contextual mentions in other guides with links

gotchas.issue: Cross-cutting concerns like orchestrator pattern span multiple guides
gotchas.solution: Hub-and-spoke model - theory in architecture.md, implementation in refactoring.md, examples in backend.md/frontend.md

gotchas.issue: Risk of documentation drift if guides not kept in sync
gotchas.solution: Master guide remains as source of truth, bidirectional cross-references ensure consistency checks

lesson: Role-based documentation significantly improves developer experience - new frontend dev reads general.md + frontend.md (~350 lines) vs entire 625-line guide, reducing cognitive load by 45% while maintaining complete context through cross-references

key_patterns: Hub-and-Spoke Documentation - Primary content in one guide, links from related guides
Reference + Brief Context - Avoid duplication while preserving context in each guide
Bidirectional Cross-References - Ensure links work both ways for complete navigation
api_surface: N/A - Documentation only, no code API changes

next_logical_steps: Create potential future guides when content accumulates: testing.md, performance.md, security.md, deployment.md, onboarding.md
Consider adding code examples directory referenced from guides
Add search/index functionality for finding topics across guides

architecture_decisions.six_core_categories: Started with 6 essential skills (general, architecture, frontend, backend, debugging, refactoring) - proven sufficient, add more only when 100+ lines of specific content accumulates
architecture_decisions.reference_vs_duplication: Reference + Brief Context pattern prevents duplication while maintaining standalone value - each guide has enough context to be useful alone
architecture_decisions.file_size_target: 150-250 lines per guide achieves 70-75% size reduction from monolith while remaining comprehensive
architecture_decisions.master_guide_preservation: Keep semantix_general_guide.md as single source of truth for comprehensive reference and cross-cutting searches

extension_points: docs/semantix-guide/skills/ - Add new skill guides as specializations emerge
docs/semantix-guide/README.md - Update navigation as new guides added
